title: Beckham family enjoy idyllic skiing holiday in Canada
text: Buy now Piste of cake! Despite her tender age, their youngest looked every inch a pro as she sped into a snow plough with ease with a wide grin on her face Clearly following in the designer's fashionable footsteps, little Harper then matched Victoria in an adorable all-white ski suit of her own, featuring a chic waist belt. Despite her tender age, their youngest looked every inch a pro as she sped into a snow plough with ease with a wide grin on her face, as David gushed in the caption: 'Gorgeous in white.' While he appeared the picture of confidence in the snaps, David later admitted that he was actually a novice on the slopes, and taking advice from his more experience kids. Newbie: While he appeared the picture of confidence in the snaps, David later admitted that he was actually a novice on the slopes Man of the hour: He looked the part however in his striking purple goggles and a chunky black ski jacket as he joined his family en route to the slopes Is it really that high? He chatted to his youngest Harper as he eyed up his next slope Back to normality: The family blended in with the other tourists at luxurious ski location Whistler Sharing a selfie of him clad in chunky pink goggles, he explained to followers: 'Don't usually post so many but it's so beautiful up here plus having a special time', before he added in honesty: 'Btw my first tine ever boarding or even on the slopes' (sic) The family appear to be spending quality time together in the winter hotspot after a hectic and fraught few weeks. Not only was Victoria busy preparing for her A/W17 showcase in New York City, emails were then leaked of David reacting angrily to not being given a knighthood. Catch me if you can! The family appear to be spending quality time together in the winter hotspot after a hectic and fraught few weeks The former England captain branded the Honours Committee ‘unappreciative c***s’ and dismissed lower awards, ranting: ‘Unless it’s a knighthood f*** off’. According to the revelations, the Honours Committee had already agreed that Beckham's nomination – almost certainly proposed by his PR advisers – was well 'merited' before a routine check of his tax affairs. Amid the huge backlash from the leak, David went on to kept a low profile in New York for Victoria's big day - enjoying a number of fun days out with just his kids. 'Cool dude': Rising above his recent email hacking scandal, David proceeded to share snaps from their ski holiday - capturing Romeo (above) ready to head down a slope Family is everything: David has been spending lots of time with his kids since the emails - which saw him slam the Honours Committee for snubbing him for a knighthood - came to light The footballer took his four youngsters to the city's Natural History Museum before heading to make their own pizzas at a local restaurant. Adding to the display of family affection, David took to his Instagram page again on Valentine's Day to post a sweet tribute to his wife, who married back in 1999. Sharing a shot of the pair kissing, he wrote sweetly in the caption: 'Happy valentines not just to My wife but to the amazing family she has given me ... 3 beautiful boys and an amazing little girl...' L-O-V-E: Adding to the display of family affection, David took to his Instagram page again on Valentine's Day to post a sweet tribute to his wife, who married back in 1999 My little Valentine: Victoria Beckham posted an adorable shot of the handwritten card Harper made for her on Tuesday Artistic: The card featured pink hearts and a red ribbon with an envelope addressed to 'mummy' Affirming the holiday as a family affair, Victoria then followed suit by sharing two snaps of her hand-made Valentine's Card from daughter Harper. Featuring a bouquet of heart-shaped roses on the front, the gift was made even sweeter by a hand-written message inside, which opened 'I love you mummy' before going on to ask Victoria to be her Valentine. Bursting with pride, she captioned the images: 'My little Valentine x VB' Meanwhile Victoria's fashion show was met with high praise and rapturous applause from guests after its debut on Sunday - with her owing her own heritage and British artist Paul Nash as inspiration. She said after the models took to the catwalk: 'This season has something fundamentally, even quintessentially British about it, while reflecting a global outlook. Ravishing in raspberry: Meanwhile Victoria's fashion show was met with high praise and rapturous applause from guests after its debut on Sunday 'Thinking about my heritage in the context of a changing landscape, I wanted to offer outfit proposals and single garments that mix the familiar with the fresh and the new.' She added: 'There’s a sense of comfort and security in that familiarity - of clothes you can relate to, and remember.' Victoria concluded: 'This is not an actual wardrobe, but a wardrobe of proposals. It’s an attitude I want to convey - of freedom, of confidence, of power. These are all clothes I want to wear; but hopefully they’re clothes - and an attitude - other women will want for themselves, too. Strength, reality, and identity.' Jet-setters: The wintry getaway is the second for the Beckhams this year, after they spent New Year's celebrations in the Maldives (above)
